creator: nettings@apache.org
text:
i'm currently playing around with custom publications that do not inherit from
the default pub. it turns out that the workflow usecases are implemented in a
publication-specific module in default. this is very odd indeed and should be
fixed before 1.4 imho.
or can anyone explain why those usecases should remain local to an example
publication?

They are quite specific to the default publication, but of course this is arguable.

Generally it is hard to decide which usecases are "generic" (if this term is
applicable to a framework) and which aren't.

Maybe we should really move all usecases from the default pub to global modules
- if someone wants a different implementation, she has to override them.
creator: andreas@apache.org
nettings@apache.org
text:
+1, with the exception of the homepage module - it's good to have one example to
show that pubs can implement local modules, and the homepage module is not
particularly useful out-of-the-box anyway.

i don't see why workflow actions should be something only provided by an example
pub, not by the global modules. to me it's a very fundamental feature of lenya.

defaultusecases is particularly weird in that the java backend is implemented as
a self-contained module within the default pub, but the jxtemplates are in
default/lenya/usecases/workflow.
if no one objects, i'll try and have a go at it.

creator: andreas@apache.org
text: I guess the defaultusecases should go into the workflow module.
